title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, 13 [april 1870]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 13 [April 1870]
text: 13 april 1870My dear waltWalti have received your letter to day the 13t i also got the papers on saturdaySaturday i am pretty well but my lameness that is bad enoughfenough my legs pains me real bad some nights i cantcan't sleep if i am on my feet much through the day i try to favor myself as much as i can i have got a woman to clean house but it all dontdon't seem to doodo) Jeff is here or he aintain't just here now but he was here this morning he came to new yorkNew York with mrMr. Crosier one of the commissioners they think of starting to night for st louisSt. Louis i expect him back now very soon he left home last thursdayThursday a week ago to morrowhe says mattyMatty is quite smart that the children aintain't half as good as they were when matt was away i had a few lines from charleyCharley HeydHeyde the other day he says han is as well as she ever will be that she is not very well that she will write me a letter that she had got mine and your letters it is real warm to day here no more this time georgeGeorge is away i have had a letter from maryMary also i wrote to her of JessesJesse's death Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 13 [April 1870]
